import React from 'react' import { Link } from 'react-router-dom' import blog1 from '../images/blog1.jpg' import '../' function Home() { const blogs = [ { title: "Blog 1: Getting Started with React", description: "This blog introduces the basics of React and how to get started with your first React app.", link: "/blog/1", image: "blogs/src/images/blog1.jpg", // Placeholder image date: "January 1, 2025" }, { title: "Blog 2: Understanding JavaScript Closures", description: "In this post, we will dive into JavaScript closures and how they work.", link: "/blog/2", image: "https://via.placeholder.com/150", // Placeholder image date: "February 10, 2025" }, { title: "Blog 3: A Guide to CSS Flexbox", description: "Learn about the powerful Flexbox layout system in CSS and how to use it for responsive designs.", link: "/blog/3", image: "https://via.placeholder.com/150", // Placeholder image date: "March 5, 2025" } ]; return ( <> {/*

read more..

*/} {/*
*/}

Latest Blogs

{blogs.map((blog, index) => (

) } export default Home
